author: Mike B
title: Well placed and lots to offer
text:
We have stayed at Spier a number of times. The grounds are extensive with a new addition of the Hoghouse, a more relaxed eating place with a bakery shop too. It's always nice to stroll around the grounds and around the lake to break up your sunbathing time. The main hotel is good but possibly needs a face lift now. Staff this time we're not as efficient as previously as we had to ask for certain things twice. The menu in the restaurant in the evening is limited because there are no smaller meals, which we would have prefered, having been out and had great food during the day.
The rooms are good although downstairs rooms that exit to the internal garden aren't available to book eight months previous to staying! The whole package of Spier is good as you are in a large but secure area. Value wise still great. Will be back, as it is well placed, being able to get to Franchoek and the airport as bonus points too.
